name: Ooty
history: Ooty, officially known as Udhagamandalam, is a popular hill station in the Nilgiri Hills of Tamil Nadu, India. Renowned for its tea plantations, lush greenery, and colonial architecture.

name: Madurai
history: Madurai, one of the oldest cities in India, is renowned for its Dravidian-style temples, vibrant markets, and lively festivals.

name: Pondicherry
tagline: A Slice of France in India
history: Pondicherry, now known as Puducherry, was a French colonial settlement until 1954. Characterized by its colonial-era buildings and vibrant culture, Pondicherry is a blend of French and Indian influences.

name: Kodaikanal
history: Kodaikanal, often referred to as the 'Princess of Hill Stations,' is famous for its scenic beauty, pristine lakes, and verdant valleys.

name: Mysore
history: Mysore, also known as the 'City of Palaces,' is renowned for its royal heritage and magnificent architecture.

name: Madikeri
history: Madikeri, often referred to as the 'Scotland of India,' is a picturesque hill station known for its misty hills, lush forests, and coffee plantations.

name: Hampi
history: Hampi, a UNESCO World Heritage Site, is an ancient city dotted with ruins of temples, palaces, and monuments.

name: Gokarna
history: Gokarna is known for its pristine beaches, sacred temples, and laid-back vibe.
